You say you only want melee champs, but in terms of 1v1's, the strongest champ is Satan's own, Teemo imo. His Q blinds any auto-orientated champion, and his poison deletes their health before they can get shots in.

But in terms of sole melee, Nasus after with anything around 400 stacks and maxed R is a hard task. At very least 20% life steal, and his abilities mean staying in melee range solo is a very hard task. Anyone with lifesteal in fact is a difficult opponent. Aatrox is another. He has life steal and you effectively have to kill him twice. Master Yi is pretty good with his final build. Not early game, but late game he usually has life steal, high auto speed and damage and his Q can negate damage if he dodges correctly. WW is the same with final build, especially with a Devourer jungle build. 

I have to disagree with the other commentors though. Sion is not a decent 1v1 champ. If he builds for health, he doesnt have enough damage, and even then if he got lucky, he's too slow to chase after any champion that runs. If he builds for damage, he won't have enough health to sustain himself in a fight. The only way he'd be suitable is if he hypothetically got a horrendous amount of health from farming, but had been building for damage.

Definitely not an assassin. Tanks are always the kings of 1v1 (but screw team fights just stand still and pretend to be Trundle's second pillar)

Garen if you have Warmogs, Spirit Visage, the enemy is the villain, and you can just waltz in and out of 1v1.
Nasus if he has enough stacks
Sion if he has enough stacks

Yorick isn't too bad, considering that not many people know what his abilities are...

"Whats a Yorick?"
Jax is the ultimate 1 v 1 duelist.
